newsitem.title: USA: Former AT&T execs to head up new company.
newsitem.headline: Former AT&T execs to head up new company.

text.p: A group of former AT&T Corp executives Thursday announced plans to form a new company aimed at providing competitive local telephone services.
The company, called OneComm L.L.C., was founded by wireless services pioneer Craig McCaw and three original employees of McCaw Cellular Communications Inc, which was acquired by AT&T in 1994.

Wayne Perry, vice chairman of AT&T Wireless Services, will become chairman of the new company. Steve Hooper, president and chief executive officer of AT&T Wireless Services, will become president, and Gerry Salemme, an AT&T vice president of federal government affairs, will become executive vice president of government and industry relations of the new company.
The executives will resign from AT&T effective May 12, but OneComm said they will continue to be available to the company for advice on a range of issues.
"We formed OneComm because we're entrepreneurs at heart and we believe that opening up the local markets to competition is the most important effort in telecommunications today," said Perry.
